Articles.Content:
I was struggling to come up with a bridge for this song until I decided it was about Minmus, and remembered my first flyby. It is therefore a KSP Fan Work.

I don't look at pictures of KSP planets until I visit them, preferring to let the difficulty flavor the experience. I remember my first visit to Minmus as being like getting socked in the head with a slice of lime wrapped around a solid rocket booster.

Genre: Space Jazz.

Over an Emerald Moon (PDF)

A recording of me playing it:

Over an Emerald Moon (Soundcloud)

Over an Emerald Moon (MP3)

I don't have a screenshot of my first flyby, so I'll shamelessly post someone else's:

Lilypond source, for those interested:

Lilypond source (links to Github)

Soundcloud

Edited September 17, 2013 by The Right Trousers
Dude, wow! I love this. Jazz piano, real, non-digitized jazz piano. Makes me wish I could play piano with more than two fingers, lol

Dude, wow! I love this. Jazz piano, real, non-digitized jazz piano. Makes me wish I could play piano with more than two fingers, lol. You really should hop on Soundcloud.com . That way you don't have to have people download the track to hear it. This is really good work and there is a good Jazz crowd on there.

OP updated with Soundcloud links. Thanks for pointing me there in my last post.

I'm definitely checking out the jazz. I've loved piano jazz it ever since I discovered Vince Guaraldi (i.e. the musician behind the Peanuts cartoons music). He was taken from us far too early...

I have always been into jazz and piano. But I lack the agility and focus to pick up the piano. I stick to digital methods only. But I have fond memories of the music in Peanuts, I heard it in Kings Dominion and could barely resist tapping my feet. I ended up tapping my feet anyhow, lol.

But I digress, thanks for the Soundcloud link!
